classDoc.commentText: Since the UUID type isn't part of the SQL standard, it is required to provide a specific mapping or converter, respectively. This implementation is taken from

This class will convert a JSON formated object into a PostgreSQL object and vice versa. It will make use of the simple-JSON library and the PGobject from the JDBC driver.

This converter must be activated for the appropriated column in the model class.

This class will convert an Integer object into a PostgreSQL object and vice versa. This converter is necessary to set or update the attribute 'xmin' of the OpenInfraModelObject automatically after a persistent insert and update (see method 'OpenInfraDao.createOrUpdate()').
This class represents the ValueListValue and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA.

methodDoc.commentText: This is a static representation of the mapToPojo method and maps a JPA model object into the referring POJO object.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the referring POJO object

paramDoc.commentText: the requested language as Java.util locale

classDoc.commentText: This class represents the ValueListValueAssociation and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA.

methodDoc.commentText: This method implements the method mapToPojo in a static way.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the POJO object when the model object is not null else null

paramDoc.commentText: the requested language as Java.util locale

classDoc.commentText: This class represents the ValueListValue and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA.

methodDoc.commentText: This method implements the method mapToPojo in a static way.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the POJO object when the model object is not null else null

paramDoc.commentText: the requested language as Java.util locale

classDoc.commentText:
This class represents the TopicInstance and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA.
This class is used as a view object and contains selected attribute types which should be displayed in an OpenInfRA list view. This object must not be used to insert data to the database. It is a view object only!

methodDoc.commentText: This method selects all configured meta data information (attribute type) and combines them with related attribute values.
This method implements the method mapToPojo in a static way.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the POJO object when the model object is not null else null

paramDoc.commentText: the requested language as Java.util locale

methodDoc.commentText: This method retrieves a list of TopicInstance objects belonging to a specified topic characteristic and where the attribute value is like the specified filter string.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of TopicInstances

paramDoc.commentText: the id of the topic characteristic
the max size of the result list

methodDoc.commentText: This method retrieves a list of TopicInstance objects belonging to a specified topic characteristic and where the attribute value has a 3D geometry.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of TopicInstances

paramDoc.commentText: the id of the topic characteristic
the size of items to provide

methodDoc.commentText: This is a special count method that returns the count of Topic Characteristic objects that contains a 3D geometry.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the count of objects

classDoc.commentText: This class represents the TopicInstanceAssociation and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA.

methodDoc.commentText: This method implements the method mapToPojo in a static way.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the POJO object when the model object is not null else null

paramDoc.commentText: the requested language as Java.util locale
The meta data DAO must not be null.

classDoc.commentText:
This class represents a TopicInstance and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA. The TopicGeomz object, in contrast to the ordinary TopicInstance object, provides additional informations for 3D geometry data that is gained from the AttributeValueGeomz object.
This class is a very specific DAO class since it doesn't extend the OpenInfRA DAO class. Thus, this class doesn't provide its own entity manager.

methodDoc.commentText: This method reads a special topic instance that contains 3D geometry data only.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a topic object

paramDoc.commentText: The topic characteristic id the topic belongs to
the size of items to provide

methodDoc.commentText: This method returns the count of Topic Characteristic objects that contains a 3D geometry.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the count of objects

classDoc.commentText:
This class represents a TopicInstance and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA. The Topic object, in contrast to the ordinary TopicInstance object, provides more information including attribute type groups, attribute types, and the associated attribute values.
This class is a very specific DAO class since it doesn't extend the OpenInfRA DAO class. Thus, this class doesn't provide its own entity manager.

methodDoc.commentText: This method reads a specific topic instance.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a topic object

paramDoc.commentText: the id of the required topic instance

classDoc.commentText: This class represents the TopicCharacteristicToRelationshipType and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA.

methodDoc.commentText: This method implements the method mapToPojo in a static way.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the POJO object when the model object is not null else null

paramDoc.commentText: the requested language as Java.util locale

classDoc.commentText: This class represents the TopicCharacteristicToAttributeTypeGroup and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA.

methodDoc.commentText: This method implements the method mapToPojo in a static way.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the POJO object when the model object is not null else null

paramDoc.commentText: the requested language as Java.util locale

classDoc.commentText:
This class represents the TopicCharacteristic and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA.
TODO this class is also very special.. verify that it fits to the new generic class!

methodDoc.commentText:
This method returns a list of topic characteristics based on a text filter (wildcard: %).
TODO generalize read method with filter for all available list methods (insert a generic method in openinfradao)

responseDoc.returnDoc: an ordered list of topic characteristics

methodDoc.commentText: This method implements the method mapToPojo in a static way.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the POJO object when the model object is not null else null

paramDoc.commentText: the requested language as Java.util locale
The meta data DAO. Must not be null!

methodDoc.commentText: This method returns a list of strings that will match to the specified parameters. It will search for attributeValues in the specified topicCharacteristic and the specified attributeType for matches to the specified string in the specified language. It will also support values that have an XX locale.

responseDoc.returnDoc: A list of strings that match to the specified parameter or null if the locale and / or the qString is not specified.

paramDoc.commentText: The locale of the query string.
The topic characteristic id the values should be part of.
The attribute type id the values should be part of. The attribute type must be used in the topic characteristic.
The query string that should be searched for.

classDoc.commentText: This class represents the RelationshipTypeToTopicCharacteristic and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA.

methodDoc.commentText: This method implements the method mapToPojo in a static way.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the POJO object when the model object is not null else null

paramDoc.commentText: the requested language as Java.util locale

classDoc.commentText: This class represents the RelationshipType and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA.

methodDoc.commentText: This method implements the method mapToPojo in a static way.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the POJO object

paramDoc.commentText: the requested language as Java.util locale

classDoc.commentText: This class represents the PtLocale and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA.

methodDoc.commentText: This method reads a PtLocale object from database using a specific locale object.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a PtLocale object

methodDoc.commentText: This method implements the method mapToPojo in a static way.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the POJO object

paramDoc.commentText: the requested language as Java.util locale

methodDoc.commentText: This method is a wrapper method of the 'forLanguageTag' of the Java.util Locale object. It returns null when the locale string is null.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the locale object or null

paramDoc.commentText: the locale which should be parsed

classDoc.commentText: This class represents the PtFreeText and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA.

methodDoc.commentText: Example description of the handling of free text by the database: one project -> one description (in many languages) -> has PtFreeText (a group of languages) -> has LocalizedCharacterString (free text + language)

classDoc.commentText: This class represents the Project and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA.

methodDoc.commentText: This method delivers a list of sub projects specified by the current project id {@see OpenInfraDao} in only one hierarchy level.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of sub projects referring to the specified project in only one hierarchy level

paramDoc.commentText: A list of Java.util locale objects. All locals which this list contains will be returned. As defined by rfc2616, the asterisk is used to retrieve all available languages.
the size of items to provide

methodDoc.commentText: This method returns the count of sub projects.

responseDoc.returnDoc: count of sub projects

methodDoc.commentText: This method delivers a list of main projects retrieved from metadata database. This method also retrieves the name and description of all main projects specified by the locale parameter.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of main projects

methodDoc.commentText: This method returns the count of main projects.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the count of main projects

methodDoc.commentText: This method implements the method mapToPojo in a static way.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the POJO object when the model object is not null else null

paramDoc.commentText: the requested language as Java.util locale

methodDoc.commentText: This method delivers a list of parents in reverse order.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of parents in reverse order

methodDoc.commentText: This is a special method which returns a hierarchical list of parent projects plus the current project.

responseDoc.returnDoc: list of parents or a list containing a null value

paramDoc.commentText: the locale of the request (shouldn't be null)

methodDoc.commentText: This is a static method which returns the current project id by the given URL string. It'll return an empty String object when the current URL doesn't contain a specific project id.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the current project id or null when not specified

methodDoc.commentText: This method decides if the project that should be created is a new sub project or a new main project. If it is a new main project it is necessary to create a new database schema and write some data into the meta data schema.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the UUID of the new created project

paramDoc.commentText: Creates an empty project schema when true.
Loads the initial data from the system schema when true. This parameter will only have an effect if createEmpty is false.

methodDoc.commentText: This method decides if the project that should be deleted is a sub project or a main project. If it is a main project it is necessary to delete the database schema and remove the project entry in the meta data schema.

responseDoc.returnDoc: true if the project was deleted

methodDoc.commentText: This method returns a OrderByPojo that represents the name of the requested class and a list of OpenInfraOrderByEnum's that will be supported by the class.

responseDoc.returnDoc: OrderByPojo The requested class name and a list of supported enum's.

paramDoc.commentText: The name of the class as string.
The schema were the request came from.

methodDoc.commentText: This method returns a OrderByNamesPojo that contains a list of class names, depending on the requested schema, that support sorting.

responseDoc.returnDoc: OrderByNamesPojo A list of class names that support sorting.

paramDoc.commentText: The schema were the request came from.

classDoc.commentText: This class extends the OpenInfraValueDao class in order to provide another generic method which reads a list of JPA model objects by two given values. Using this class prerequisites a named query of the TypeModel object.

methodDoc.commentText: This method deletes an association entity from the database. Previously it checks if meta data exists for this entity and delete it as well.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the uuid of the association when the association was deleted, otherwise null

methodDoc.commentText: This is a generic method which reads a list of TypePojos defined by two specific UUID values (e.g. get a list of objects which belong to a combination of two specific objects). This method presumes a corresponding named query of the TypeModel object.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of objects of type POJO class which directly belong to the TypeModelValue and TypeModelValue2 classes

paramDoc.commentText: the specific id of the first required value object
the specific id of the second required value object
the size of items to provide

methodDoc.commentText: This method checks if the first associated id that is part of the URI matches with the association id in the POJO and the second associated id that is part of the URI matches with the id of the associated object in the POJO. If the matches are fulfilled the createOrUpdate method of the OpenInfraDao will be called. Otherwise it will return null.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the UUID of the newly created or replaced object or null

paramDoc.commentText: the POJO object which should be stored in the database
the first association id from the URI
the first association id from the POJO
the second association id from the URI
the second association id from the POJO
the JSON data that should be stored in the meta data associated to the POJO

classDoc.commentText: This class extends the OpenInfraDao class in order to provide another generic method which reads a list of JPA model objects by a given value. Using this class prerequisites a named query of the TypeModel object.

methodDoc.commentText: This is a generic method which reads a list of TypePojos defined by a specific UUID value (e.g. get a list of objects which belong to a specific object). This method presumes a corresponding named query of the TypeModel object.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of objects of type POJO class which directly belong to the TypeModelValue class

paramDoc.commentText: the specific id of the required value object
the size of items to provide

methodDoc.commentText: This method checks if the first associated id that is part of the URI matches with the association id in the POJO. If the matches are fulfilled the createOrUpdate method of the OpenInfraDao will be called. Otherwise it will return null.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the UUID of the newly created or replaced object or null

paramDoc.commentText: the POJO object which should be stored in the database
the first association id from the URI
the first association id from the POJO
the JSON data that should be stored in the meta data associated to the POJO

methodDoc.commentText:
This is a generic method which reads a list of TypePojos defined by a specific UUID value (e.g. get a list of objects which belong to a specific object). This method presumes a corresponding named query of the TypeModel object.
It provides the possibility to sort the list.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of objects of type POJO class which directly belong to the TypeModelValue class

paramDoc.commentText: the specific id of the required value object
the column that should be used for sorting
the size of items to provide

methodDoc.commentText: This method returns the count of objects referring a specific object.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the count of objects or -1 if the value id doesn't exists

classDoc.commentText: This class is used to provide a sophisticated way to manage the JPA entity manager.

methodDoc.commentText: This is the default generic method which provides read access to the selected database schema without sorting. It is almost the same routine for all DAO classes to access the database.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of objects of type POJO class

paramDoc.commentText: the size of items to provide

methodDoc.commentText:
This is a generic method which provides read access to the selected database schema. It is almost the same routine for all DAO classes to access the database. If not, this method should be extended in order to avoid overrides. Overrides could increase the effort regarding the integration and maintenance of a rights management system.
Since the system schema doesn't provide the project_id column for topic characteristic objects it is necessary to handle this request separately.
The meta data schema is also handled separately.
Don't use this method while using RBAC, FILE or WEBAPP schemas!

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of objects of type POJO class

paramDoc.commentText: the size of items to provide

methodDoc.commentText: A special method which returns model objects. This method is primarily used to create a search index.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of all model objects

methodDoc.commentText: This function creates a new or updates an existing object in the database. The update function depends on the specified language.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the UUID of the newly created or replaced object

paramDoc.commentText: the POJO object which should be stored in the database
the UUID of the specific object - should be null for create or POST requests

methodDoc.commentText: This method will first execute a createOrUpdate for the TypePojo and second execute a createOrUpdate for the meta data. This is necessary for project and system databases where tables can store meta data inside the table meta_data.

paramDoc.commentText: the POJO object which should be stored in the database
the value id from the URI
the JSON data that should be stored in the meta data associated to the POJO

methodDoc.commentText: This is a generic method which reads a specific pojo object. We decided to hide this functionality behind a protected class so that each deriving class must implement its own read method. This should provide more type safety.

responseDoc.returnDoc: The requested POJO object if present otherwise null.

paramDoc.commentText: the UUID of the required model class

methodDoc.commentText:
This is an abstract method which must be implemented by deriving classes. It should map a JPA model object into corresponding a POJO object.
This method is really slow. Thus, don't use this method too often. It's recommended to provide another static method which should be much faster.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a corresponding POJO object

methodDoc.commentText: This is an abstract method which must be implemented by deriving classes. It should map a POJO object into a corresponding JPA model object.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a corresponding JPA model object

methodDoc.commentText: This method deletes an entity from the database. Previously it checks if meta data exists for this entity and delete it as well.

responseDoc.returnDoc: true when the entity was deleted false when the uuid doesn't exists

paramDoc.commentText: the uuid which specifies the entity

methodDoc.commentText: This method retrieves the count of objects and uses a named query. If the query doesn't exists, it will throw an exception.

responseDoc.returnDoc: count of objects or zero

classDoc.commentText: This class represents the Multiplicity and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA.

methodDoc.commentText: This is a static representation of the mapToPojo method and maps a JPA model object into the referring POJO object.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the POJO object when the model object is not null else null

methodDoc.commentText: This is a special read method for extracting a meta data model from the database to a corresponding object id.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the meta data model for the object id

classDoc.commentText: A set of attribute value types defined by the database schema definition. Upper case letters are use since these types are constants.

This enumeration describes possible output formats for the data type geometry.

methodDoc.commentText: This is a specific read method which provides the ability to set a specific geometry type.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the requested object

methodDoc.commentText: This method creates a AttributeValuePojo shell that contains some informations about the topicInstance, the attributeType and the locale.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the AttributeValuePojo

paramDoc.commentText: the id of the topic instance the attribute value belongs to
the attribute type of the attribute value
the locale the informations should be saved at

methodDoc.commentText: It is not possible to write the AttributeValue directly because of a constraint. The appropriated AttributeValuePojo must be extracted and distributed separately to their respective createOrUpdate methods.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the UUID of the created or updated object or null if an error occurs or the geomType is unlike GeoJSON

methodDoc.commentText: This class is not an OpenInfraValueValue class. However, it is necessary to retrieve a list of subject-objects which refer to one project.

classDoc.commentText: This is the DAO class for users. In this case the map to model method skips some values of the model class. This includes the salt string and the password sting. These values should not be transferred to the client.

methodDoc.commentText: This method reads a RBAC model object by login from database. This is required for Apache Shiro login.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the subject (user) as model object

methodDoc.commentText: This method updates the login time of the current user.

classDoc.commentText: This class supplies methods to create primer objects and to request primer classes using a singleton implementation.

methodDoc.commentText: Creates a primer object for the given schema and pojo class.

responseDoc.returnDoc: primer object if pojoClass and the schema exist in the pojo hash map otherwise throws OpenInfraWebException

methodDoc.commentText: Returns all primer class names for the given schema.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of all primer class names if schema exists in the pojo hash map, otherwise throws OpenInfraWebException

classDoc.commentText: OpenInfraOrderBy is an enumeration of the possible sort orderings.
This enumeration entails the possible schemas and can be used to decide which schema should be used.

This enumeration defines table columns which should be ordered. In addition a list of model classes must be specified that will support this column for sorting.
The enum must be written in the same way as the table column name that should be sorted.

methodDoc.commentText: This method returns all enum's that contain the passed object as property.

responseDoc.returnDoc: A list of OpenInfraOrderByEnum's that contain the object

paramDoc.commentText: The name of the OpenInfra object

methodDoc.commentText: This method returns all objects as string list, that are used as properties in the enum's. Duplicates are ignored.

responseDoc.returnDoc: A list of strings that are properties of the enum's

classDoc.commentText: This class represents a order by object. This object will either contain an OpenInfraOrderByEnum or an UUID.

methodDoc.commentText: This functions returns the content of the object. The content can be a UUID or a OpenInfraOrderByEnum.

responseDoc.returnDoc: Either a UUID or a OpenInfraOrderByEnum.

classDoc.commentText: This enumeration defines the keys that can be used in the meta data table and will be used by the core.
This class implements access to the meta database using a singleton implementation.

methodDoc.commentText: This method retrieves the connection string and credentials required for accessing the current project. The current project id is set by the constructor method.

responseDoc.returnDoc: The connection string and credentials required to access the current project.

classDoc.commentText: This class represents a result which is created when an POJO object is mapped to a JPA model object.
This class is a container to cache objects from the class EntityManagerFactory. The class uses the singleton implementation.

methodDoc.commentText: Returns an entity factory manager for the given parameters.

responseDoc.returnDoc: entity factory manager if an entry exists in the cache or it is possible to add an entry in the cache for the given parameters, otherwise null

methodDoc.commentText: Returns the maximum number of cache entries.

responseDoc.returnDoc: maximum number of cache entries

methodDoc.commentText: Sets the maximum number of cache entries

paramDoc.commentText: new maximum number of cache entries

methodDoc.commentText: This is a special method which implements its own permission check.
This is a generic method to delete associations.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the uuid of the association when the association was deleted, otherwise null

paramDoc.commentText: the method which has been used to access the current resource

methodDoc.commentText: This is a generic method which is provided by all RBAC classes.
This is a generic method which is provided by all RBAC classes.

classDoc.commentText: This enumeration might help to identify the information which is stored in it's principal collection. However, this is currently not used very intensively. Thus, this might be removed in the future.

This is the OpenInfraRealm which is used to retrieve user-specific information from database. The idea behind this implementation was: 'keep it stupid and simple' and it's closely related to the implementation of the origin jdbcRealm.

methodDoc.commentText: This method is used to return all available permissions of a subject.
Creates an encrypted password. <a href="http://shiro.apache.org/realm.html"/>

responseDoc.returnDoc: the encrypted password

classDoc.commentText: This class implements the role-based access control layer. Methods of this class are called by rest classes and the call passes a user (subject) permissions check. When the permissions check is successful, the underlying DAO class is called.

methodDoc.commentText: This is a generic method which is provided by all RBAC classes.
This is a generic method which is provided by all RBAC classes.
This is a generic method which is provided by all RBAC classes.
This is a generic method which is provided by all RBAC classes.
This is a generic method which is provided by all RBAC classes.
This is a generic method which is provided by all RBAC classes.
This is a generic method which is provided by all RBAC classes.

responseDoc.returnDoc: true when the object has been deleted

methodDoc.commentText: This method returns the current subject as POJO object.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the current subject as POJO object

classDoc.commentText: An enumeration which holds ordinary HTTP methods and the corresponding access string.
This class represents the AttributeTypeGroupToAttributeType and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA.
This is the OpenInfRA web exception. Every OpenInfRA exception should extend this exception.
These enumeration define the OpenInfRA exception types and their corresponding error messages.

This is an exception item which is send to the client when something goes wrong.
http://slackspace.de/articles/jersey-how-to-provide-meaningful-exception-messages/
This class provides an exception for the database.
This class represents a response filter and is used to add the session time out for every subject (user) to a specific header field.

This class represents the request filter which is configured to be a pre-matching filter. This is required since the filter must be accessed before the available REST URLs are parsed.
Currently, this filter is used to replace the accept header and forward the the request to the origin URI when the requested URI ends with '.xml' or '.json'. This helps to keep the REST API straight and consistent while the URI extension can be additionally provided.
There still exists another filter which is used to remove trailing slashes from the URI. This filter is still necessary since it is executed before this filter and directly redirects (including URL rewriting) to the origin URI. This behavior cannot be achieved here.
This class is only used for testing purposes. It generates a bunch of UUIDs.
This enumeration provides a list of potential URLS.
This class is used to retrieve images from the BTU server.

methodDoc.commentText: This method returns a URL of a specific image string.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the URL of this image

classDoc.commentText: This ennum defines the image sizes.
This static class is responsible for generating a bread crumb navigation for the front end.

methodDoc.commentText:
This functions creates the bread crumb navigation. It constructs the crumbs by analyzing the passed URL. Because of the fact, that the navigation history can not be drained from the URL, special treatments are necessary. The returned crumbs will be in the order [[URL], [CRUMB NAME], [URL], [CRUMB NAME], ...]
TODO this method should not be here in this class! TODO very hard coded method

classDoc.commentText: This class supplies methods to request classes for a given package name or a reflections object ( Reflections).

methodDoc.commentText: This method finds all classes for the given package name (the result also includes classes of the sub packages).

responseDoc.returnDoc: list of all classes for the given package name

methodDoc.commentText: This method finds all classes for the given reflections object.

responseDoc.returnDoc: list of all classes for the given reflections object

classDoc.commentText:
This class is used to extend the build-in generation of the WADL by Java-DOC enriched information.
This class is intrinsingly part of the REST API. But it is also configured by the {@see OpenInfraApplication} class. We decided to place it in this package next to where it is registered.
See: https://irfannagoo.wordpress.com/2012/12/20/jersey-extended-wadl-support/ http://razvancaraghin.blogspot.de/2014/01/html-documentation-for-your-rest.html http://biemond.blogspot.de/2013/08/custom-jersey-wadl-generation.html
The WADL doclet is automatically generated by the Maven install process.
This class is a simple implementation for retrieving the current time as a timestamp. This implementation should be used application wide.

methodDoc.commentText: This method formats a date into a string.

responseDoc.returnDoc: The string or null if the input date is null.

paramDoc.commentText: The date that should be parsed into a string.

methodDoc.commentText: This method parses a string into a date. If the string could not be parsed null will be returned.

responseDoc.returnDoc: The date or null if the string could not be parsed.

paramDoc.commentText: The string that should be parsed into a date.

methodDoc.commentText: This method returns the current timestamp.

responseDoc.returnDoc: The current timestamp.

classDoc.commentText: This enumeration defines the specific database variables. Keys are defined in another enumeration. {@see OpenInfraPropertyKeys}
This enumeration defines the used property keys. The values are defined in another enumeration. {@see OpenInfraDbProperties}
OpenInfRA properties implemented as singletons.

methodDoc.commentText: This method retrieves the required information from the property file located in the resource folder.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the value referenced by the key

paramDoc.commentText: the key of the required value

methodDoc.commentText: This method retrieves the information that are necessary to connect to the central database. It contain the JDBC driver, user, password and database URL. It will retrieve the information from the OpenInfRA.properties file.

responseDoc.returnDoc: connection properties for the central database

classDoc.commentText: This class is responsible for retrieving informations about the plugins in OpenInfRA. TODO this class is just a quick workaround to provide a method that check if a plugin exists as package

methodDoc.commentText: This method simply checks if the passed name is a plugin package.

responseDoc.returnDoc: True if the plugin was found, else false.

paramDoc.commentText: The name of the plugin we should look for.

classDoc.commentText:
This class is represents the main class of the OpenInfRA application. It is used to configure application specific stuff such as the Jersey JAX-RS and HTML template engines. This class is referenced in the web.xml file and will be called during application start.
Moreover, this class creates the necessary directory structure and tests if the external packages such as ImageMagick are available. An exception is thrown when something goes wrong. This exception should be written to tomcat log files (e.g. catalina.out).

methodDoc.commentText: This method is used to identify if the OpenInfRA application runs on Windows or not.

responseDoc.returnDoc: true if it runs on Windows

methodDoc.commentText: This method delivers the OpenInfRA version provided by the Maven pom file. In order to change the version number change it in the pom.xml file.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the current version as String

classDoc.commentText: This class represents the PtLocal resource of the REST API.

This class supports only the schemas system, rbac or metadata. For the schema projects use the class 'de.btu.openinfra.backend.rest.project/PrimerResource' instead. The reason therefore lay in the fact that the regex expression '/v1/{schema:(projects|system|rbac|metadata)}{optional:(/?)} {projectId:([0-9a-f]{8}-([0-9a-f]{4}-){3}[0-9a-f]{12})?}' does not work for the schema projects.
This class represents and implements the OrderBy resource.
This is a simple container that is used to return a JSON object to the client. This is strictly required by jQuery.
This class is used to generate a HTML view out of the XML-based rest API documentation (WADL).

methodDoc.commentText:
The HTML page you're seeing is the result of this method.
This method is used to transform the WADL into HTML output. Therefore, the injected URI info is used to retrieve the application. The application is used to generate the entire WADL as XML. Afterwards, a specific XSTL file is loaded which is subsequently used to transform the WADL into HTML.

classDoc.commentText: This class is a helper class which is used to build responses in an uniform way.

methodDoc.commentText: This method builds a response for post requests.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a specific and pre-build response

methodDoc.commentText: This method builds a response for put requests.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a specific and pre-build response

methodDoc.commentText: This method builds a response for delete requests.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a specific and pre-build response

paramDoc.commentText: the result of the delete function
the id of the deleted object

methodDoc.commentText: This method builds a response for delete requests.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a specific and pre-build response

paramDoc.commentText: the id of the deleted object

methodDoc.commentText: This method builds a response for get requests.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a response containing the object otherwise an HTTP 404

paramDoc.commentText: the object that should be returned

classDoc.commentText: This class represents and implements the Multiplicity resource.
This class represents and implements the AttributeTypeGroupResource resource.

methodDoc.commentText: This method represents a specific HTTP GET method and is used to retrieve a list sub groups of an AttributeTypeGroup.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of AttributeTypeGroups (sub groups)

classDoc.commentText: This class exports CSV files.

methodDoc.commentText: This method executes the XSL transformation.

You'll need to install ufraw under Linux-based OS when you want to support DNG images.
You'll need to install ghostview in order to support PDF thumbnail generation.
A resource to support url-based file upload.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a file pojo

classDoc.commentText: This class transforms XML files into PDF files.

methodDoc.commentText: This method executes the transformation. http://www.e-zest.net/blog/integrating-apache-fop-with-java-project-to-generate-pdf-files/

This method will read a list of topic instances for a specific topic characteristic id. Additional to the standard query parameter it will accept a filter parameter and orderBy parameter. It is possible to set both orderBy parameter simultaneously but the
This is a special representation of the topic object. It delivers always a list of topic instances with corresponding 3D attribute values as X3D.
This is a special representation of the topic object. It delivers always a list of topic instances with corresponding 3D attribute values as X3D.

This resource will return a list of attribute values for a given query string. The list will only contain values that belong to a specified topic characteristic and a specified attribute type. The localization of the string will depend on the requested language.

responseDoc.returnDoc: A list of strings that match to the specified parameter or null if the locale and / or the qString is not specified.

paramDoc.commentText: The language of the query string.
The topic characteristic id the values should be part of.
The attribute type id the values should be part of. The attribute type must be used in the topic characteristic.
The query string that should be searched for.

classDoc.commentText: This class represents the project resource of the REST API. You can access an overview of all available HTTP methods by calling the following link: http://localhost:8080/openinfra_backend/rest/application.wadl The project resource is available by calling the following link: http://localhost:8080/openinfra_backend/rest/projects

methodDoc.commentText: This method provides a list of all projects. The provided parameters are used for paging.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of projects <= size (window within offset and size)

methodDoc.commentText: This method provides a specific project.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the requested project

methodDoc.commentText: This method delivers a list of sub projects specified by the current project id in only one hierarchy level.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of sub projects

methodDoc.commentText:
This method creates a new project.
You can access this method via curl. An example of the command line could be as follows:
curl.exe -X "POST" -H "Content-Type: application/xml" -d @path/to/file http://localhost:8080/openinfra_backend/projects
Use the following command to crate an empty schema which is required by the XML import/export interface:
curl -i -b cookie.txt -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d

responseDoc.returnDoc: an UUID of the created project
a response with the specific status
a response with the specific status

methodDoc.commentText: This method is not secured by the RBAC system since it retrieves the information of the current subject (user). Each subject should be able to view its own informations.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the current subject as pojo

methodDoc.commentText: This method retrieves all projects the current user has write access.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of project POJOs

methodDoc.commentText: This method retrieves all permissions the current user belongs to. Some of these permissions are automatically generated by the OpenInfRA Realm and might not be part of the Subject POJO.

responseDoc.returnDoc: a list of permissions

classDoc.commentText: This class is used to retrieve all available OpenInfRA related roles. Every role must be manually defined with a related adaption of the RBAC implementation. Thus, this class only provides GET methods. PUT, POST or DELETE are not provided here!

This class is used to retrieve all available OpenInfRA objects which can be secured by the role-based access control system. Every related object must be manually defined with a related adaption of the RBAC implementation. Thus, this class only provides GET methods. PUT, POST or DELETE are not provided here!
This class represents the LanguageCodes resource of the REST API.
This class represents the PtLocal resource of the REST API.
This class represents and implements the Multiplicity resource.
This class represents and implements the AttributeTypeGroupResource resource.

The same as by WebappResource we only provide GET and PUT methods. There is only one entry per web-application allowed which should be registered or deleted by the owner of the web-application.
Registration and delete methods might be part of the system administration in the future.

The web-application schema is used to provide a persistent storage for applications (mostly web-applications) which work with the OpenInfRA REST API. The current resource only provides a READ and a PUT method.
POST isn't provided since the web-application owner is obliged to register the application by the OpenInfRA owner.
DELETE isn't provided since the OpenInfRA owner is obliged to delete unnecessary web-application registrations.
There is no GET method which provides a list of all available web-applications. Thus every web-application must be aware of it's own id. Thus, it becomes more difficult (but it's not impossible) to catch the id of a different web-application.

A very simple servlet which is only used to transport the OpenInfRA version to the client application.
This dedicated servlet is necessary since the Jersey servlet is registered at the path '/openinfra_core/rest'. There exists an agreement that the version relates to the software itself and not only to the rest application. Thus, the new servlet registers (see web.xml) the software version number at the path '/openinfra_core/version'.
OpenInfRA properties implemented as singleton.

methodDoc.commentText: This method retrieves the required information from the property file located in the resource folder.

responseDoc.returnDoc: the value referenced by the key

paramDoc.commentText: the key of the required value
the case sensitive name of the plugin

classDoc.commentText: This POJO is a container for the search request from the client. It contains either a simple query in Solr syntax (input from simple search) or a list of complex query parts (input from extended search). The lists of projects and topic characteristics will be used to filter the results.
This POJO is a container for the result of a Solr query. It contains all Solr result pojos and some meta data for the request.
This POJO is a container for a database result of a Solr query.
This POJO is a container for a index request from the client. It contains a list of project UUIDs that should be indexed.
This POJO is a container for a part of the complex search query that is generated by the extended search.
This enum contains the standard Solr index fields.
This enum maps the possible relational operators to the Solr syntax.
This enum maps the possible mandatory choices to the Solr syntax.
This enum maps the possible logic operators to the Solr syntax.
This enum maps the possible data types that are required for indexing.
This class represents and implements the Search resource.
This class represents and implements the Search resource.
This class provides suggestions from the Solr index.

methodDoc.commentText: This method realize a suggestion on the Solr index for the specified string. It will return a list of matching strings that were found in the Solr index.

responseDoc.returnDoc: A list of strings

paramDoc.commentText: The string that should be the base for the suggestion.

classDoc.commentText: This class creates a connection to the Solr server.

This class is responsible for mapping a query request to Solr search query. After mapping it will send the query to the Solr server and receive the result. The result will be prepared and send back to the client.

methodDoc.commentText: This will start the search with the passed search term and return the result. Before returning the result it will be prepared in a special way. To avoid doublet the properties of {@link SolrIndexEnum#DEFAULT_SEARCH_FIELD} and {@link SolrIndexEnum#LOOKUP_FIELD} will be removed from the highlight map.

classDoc.commentText: This class handles the parsing of the query. It would be better to implement an own queryParser and add it to the solrconfig.xml!

methodDoc.commentText: This method returns a search query in Solr syntax. It will parse the requested SolrSearchPojo and replace the field names for correct matching to the Solr index.

responseDoc.returnDoc: A String that represents the search query in Solr syntax.

classDoc.commentText: This enumeration defines the used property keys. The values are defined in another enumeration. {@see SolrProperties}
This class is responsible for the Solr index. It provides functions to add, update and delete documents to the index. It also provides a complete index build function.

methodDoc.commentText: This method starts the indexing process. It will accept a list of UUIDs that represents the project IDs. If the List is empty, all projects that can be found in the meta database will be indexed.

paramDoc.commentText: A list of project UUIDs that should be indexed.

methodDoc.commentText:
This method will create or update a Solr document from the passed topic instance model. The document always have a unique id that is represented by the topic instance id. Every Solr document will hold the information about the project id, the topic characteristic id and all attribute types and values that belongs to the topic instance.
The attribute types will be used as field name. The attribute values will be used as field values. Every field will be saved in each language it is translated to. If only the attribute type or the attribute value is translated, the whole tuple will not be indexed. It should be avoided to mix the different languages in the index.
This method does not commit the document to Solr, because it is performing more effectively to commit all docs at once.

responseDoc.returnDoc: SolrInputDocument the Solr document

paramDoc.commentText: The Topic Instance model that should be indexed.

methodDoc.commentText: This method deletes a specific document from the Solr index.

paramDoc.commentText: The Topic Instance model that should be indexed.

methodDoc.commentText: This method deletes all documents from the Solr index.

responseDoc.returnDoc: True if the deletion was successful, else false.

classDoc.commentText: This class will convert special characters. This is necessary because Solr does not accept every character as field name. The conversion is necessary while indexing the data and while querying.

methodDoc.commentText: This method converts the input string. It will map all defined characters and disallowed characters.

responseDoc.returnDoc: The converted string in lower case

paramDoc.commentText: The string that should be converted
